body.p:
Frankfort Ky
April 1863. --
His Excellency J F. Robinson

Your petitioner Timothy Sullivan would respectfully represent to your Excellency that some time in the month of February last he was fined before J. R. Graham, Police Judge of Frankfort the sum of Ten Dollars, for an alledged breach of the peace. Your petitioner would further state that at the time of the occurrence he was under the influence of liquor and is unable to state what did occur, that he is a poor man and has to rely upon his daily labor for a support, that owing to the times and difficulty of procuring work he finds that a support is all that can possibly be made, and that any fine however small is a serious matter with a laboring man with
a family, he humbly prays your Excellency to remit the fine if in your judgment the costs are enough for him to pay.
If however you do not deem it a case in which you can use the Executive Clemency to the fullest extent, he prays that a respite may be granted to enable him to make the money to pay of the fine
We the undersigned citizens unite in the prayer of Timothy Sullivan and respectfully ask that his petition be granted.

H S Ellis
A Henley
Edmond Bowns
A Kahr
W. H. Greenup
Nelson Alley
H, R, Powell
Richd Sharp
Thomas. J. Frazier.
B. F Johnson

Frankfort Co. Court
$10. } Breach of the Peace
Timothy Sullivan
Respd 4 Novr
Issd May 1st 1863.

Respite for Four Months
J F Robinson
